comment._content: Adoree Villany first came to notoriety for her "Dance of the Seven Veils" in 1905; she was tried for obscenity in Munich in 1911-12, for her dancing "without clothing."  She also published a book, _Tanz-Reform und Pseudo-Moral_, setting forth her philosophy of modern dance.

comment._content: For a short bio from Weimar and Now: German Cultural Criticism, by MR Karl Toepfer, see books.google.com/books?id=FgvYUZh75WwC&lpg=PA22&o... or by the same author, in Empire of Ecstasy publishing.cdlib.org/ucpressebooks/view?docId=ft167nb0sp&...
